property.name: kernel.shmmax
property.description: The maximum size, in bytes, of a single shared memory segment that a Linux process can allocate in its virtual address space. The default is 1000000000.

property.name: kernel.shmmni
property.description: The maximum number of shared memory segments allowed system-wide. The default is 4096.

property.name: kernel.shmall
property.description: The total number of shared memory pages that can be used system-wide. The default is 4000000000.

property.name: kernel.sem
property.description: Parameter used to define semaphore-related values. The default is 250 512000 100 2048.

property.name: kernel.sysrq
property.description: Determines whether to enable or disable functions of sysrq. Set to 1 to enable or 0 to disable. The default is 1 (enabled).

property.name: kernel.core_uses_pid
property.description: Determines whether to append the process ID to the name of the core dump file. For example, core.PID. Set to 1 to enable or 0 to disable. The default is 1 (enabled).

property.name: kernel.msgmnb
property.description: The maximum size of a message, in bytes. The default is 65336.

property.name: kernel.msgmax
property.description: The maximum size of a message queue, in bytes. The default is 65336.

property.name: kernel.msgmni
property.description: The maximum number of message queue identifiers. The default is 2048.

property.name: net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies
property.description: Determines whether to enable or disable SYN cookie protection. Set to 1 to enable or 0 to disable. The default is 0 (disabled).

property.name: net.ipv4.ip_forward
property.description: Determines whether to enable or disable IP forwarding. Set to 1 to enable or 0 to disable. The default is 0 (disabled).

property.name: net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route
property.description: Determines whether to enable or disable IP source routing. Set to 1 to enable or 0 to disable. The default is 0 (disabled).

property.name: net.ipv4.tcp_tw_recycle
property.description: Determines whether to enable or disable fast recycling of TIME_WAIT sockets. Set to 1 to enable or 0 to disable. The default is 1 (enabled).

property.name: net.ipv4.tcp_max_syn_backlog
property.description: The maximum number of outstanding syn requests allowed. The default is 200000.

property.name: net.ipv4.conf.all.arp_filter
property.description: Determines whether to enable or disable route lookup to select the interface for replies. Set to 1 to enable or 0 to disable. The default is 1 (enabled).

property.name: net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range
property.description: The local port range, specified by two values separated by a space, used by TCP and UDP traffic when choosing the local port. The default is 1025 65535.

property.name: net.core.netdev_max_backlog
property.description: The maximum number of packets allowed to queue when a particular interface receives packets faster than the kernel can process them. The default is 200000.

property.name: fs.nr_open
property.description: The maximum number of file handles that a process can allocate. The default is 3000000.

property.name: kernel.threads-max
property.description: The maximum number of threads that can be used by the kernel at one time system-wide. The default is 798720.

property.name: kernel.pid_max
property.description: The maximum number of unique process identifiers. The default is 798720.

property.name: net.core.rmem_max
property.description: The maximum size of the receive socket buffer, in bytes. The default is 2097152.

property.name: net.core.wmem_max
property.description: The maximum size of the send socket buffer, in bytes. The default is 2097152.

property.name: vm.overcommit_memory
property.description: Establishes the conditions for determining whether large memory requests are accepted or denied. The three possible values for this parameter are: 0, 1 or 2. For production environments, the value of 2 is recommended and means that processes will not be killed but will receive errors upon memory allocation. The default value is 1.
